title: Heteronym Provenance Document: Rebekah Cranes (HET-CRANES-001)

creators.name: Sharks, Lee
creators.affiliation: Johannes Sigil Institute for Comparative Poetics

description:
Canonical Registry Entry for the Crimson Hexagon Heteronym System

This document establishes the provenance, functions, and cross-anchoring relationships for Rebekah Cranes (HET-CRANES-001), a heteronym within the Crimson Hexagon distributed epic architecture.

Primary Functions: Visual Artist, Translator, Liturgical Witness, Chair of the Institute for Diagrammatic Poetics (IDP)

Primary Anchor Work: Day and Night: Conversations with Sapphic Desire (DOI: 10.5281/zenodo.18202658) — the canonical translation that anchors the Sappho Room of the Crimson Hexagon.

Core Insight: "The absolutely particular and untranslatable is coterminous with the absolutely universal. The untranslatable is the only element that will make it across."

Co-Constitutive With: IDP-2026-01-CHARTER, Day and Night, Visual Schema Navigation Map, Sappho Room

This document is part of the NH-OS (New Human Operating System) framework and follows the Assembly Payload Protocol for AI-mediated traversal.
